flawed_nl_solution:
The nuts are $25 and he has a $5 coupon, so the nuts are on sale for $25-$5 = $<<25-5=18>>18
He eats 1 oz of nuts every evening and the bag has 40 oz of nuts, so it has 40/1 = <<40/1=40>>40 1 oz servings
The nuts cost $18 and there are 40 servings per bag, so his snack is $18/40 = $<<18/40=0.45>>0.45 per serving
#### 45

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 18. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
